intro: Kibatalia puberula, commonly known as the African sandalwood, is a small evergreen tree native to eastern Africa. It belongs to the family Burseraceae and is characterized by its smooth, pale bark and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers followed by spherical, woody fruits containing aromatic seeds. It thrives in humid, tropical climates and is often found in forested areas with well-drained soils. Due to its fragrant wood, it has been historically valued for its use in traditional medicine and as a source of incense.
